quote: None of this matters
Death is certain
Melancholy is sadness that has taken on lightness.
Everybody should do in their lifetime, sometime, two things. One is to consider death. To observe skulls and skeletons and to wonder what it will be like to go to sleep and never wake up. Never.
It don't matter. None of this matters
And if you gaze for long into an abyss, the abyss gazes also into you.
To live is to suffer, to survive is to find some meaning in the suffering.
We have art in order not to die of the truth.
But everyone disappears, no matter who loves them.
Anyone who has lost something they thought was theirs forever finally comes to realise that nothing really belongs to them.
It all goes away. Eventually, everything goes away.
Many have died; you also will die.
The drum of death is being beaten.
Only sayings of the wise will remain.
All things that have form eventually decay.
A thousand years ago five minutes were Equal to forty ounces of fine sand. Outstare the stars. Infinite foretime and Infinite aftertime: above your head They close like giant wings, and you are dead.
Ages and epochs belong to Time. Only the fleeting moment is eternal.
Passing pleasures, like passing clouds, are all we have.
The line between life and death is not thicker than an eyelid.
Nothing endures but change.
That nothing is static or fixed, that all is fleeting and impermanent, is the first mark of existence. It is the ordinary state of affairs. Everything is in process.
We are healed of a suffering only by experiencing it to the full.

I think about the cosmic snowball theory. A few million years from now the sun will burn out and lose its gravitational pull. The earth will turn into a giant snowball and be hurled through space. When that happens it won't matter if I get this guy out.
attribution: Bill Lee, Major League Baseball pitcher, 1969-82

quote: Go -- not knowing where. Bring -- not knowing what. The path is long, the way unknown.
You cannot live without dying.
Love your life, poor as it is.
Death is more universal than life. Everyone dies but not everyone lives.
You may be anybody now. One day, you will be just a faded memory.
For beneath the winter is a winter so endless that to survive it at all is a triumph of the heart.
Detachment is not giving up the things in this world, but accepting the fact and to be continuously aware that nothing is permanent.
None of this matters
Death is constantly looming over us
Remember, we all die alone :)
Do, or do not, none of this matters
We're all made out of dust, and will end up as dust
Don't worry about your enemies from high school. They're going to die alone too
I can't wait for the sun to explode
I hope I cut myself shaving tomorrow. I hope it bleeds all day long
I hope we hang on past the last exit, I hope it's already too late
I hope the junkyard a few blocks from here someday burns down. And I hope the rising black smoke carries me far away and I never come back here again
I hope it stays dark forever
I hope it stays dark forever, I hope the worst isn't over. I hope you blink before I do, and I hope I never get sober.
I am drowning. There is no sign of land. You are coming down with me; hand in unlovable hand.
Sometimes you gotta pretend everything is okay. It's not.
It's always worse than it seems. It is.
No amount of sleep in the world could cure the tiredness I feel. Except for sweet cold death.
Life's so fragile, a successful virus clinging to a speck of mud, suspended in endless nothing.
It makes no difference, night or day. The shadow never seems to fade away. And the sun don't shine anymore. And the rains fall down on my door
I think we are just insects, we live a bit and then die and that’s the lot. There’s no mercy in things. There’s not even a Great Beyond. There’s nothing.
You needn't look at the sky because it's not going to open up and show no place behind it.
Nothing matters very much and most things don't matter at all.
Every existing thing is born without reason, prolongs itself out of weakness and dies by chance.
We rise to meet each day because there will come a time when the day will rise without us.
Somethings may stay in memory for a while but eventually that too fades away.
Eventually everything appears to disappear from the life. That's it.
The very concept of happiness is conditional, a fiction.
Everything is decaying. We are continually losing all that we come in contact with.
One must be deeply aware of the impermanence of the world.

Everything desperately struggling to keep its nose above water for a few breaths before its strength inevitably failed and down it went, pressed under by something else. And beyond, those brainless, handless idiotic stars, lazing away so importantly for nothing.
One day, while life is being incredible and interesting, I’m going to die.
And here's a secret for you - everything beautiful is sad...gilded with impermanence.
Your body is like a dew-drop on the morning grass, your life is as brief as a flash of lightning. Momentary and vain, it is lost in a moment.
Leave behind what was never yours and accept the fact that momentary pleasures and hideous treasures will perish too soon.
Human race spoilers: we go extinct and none of this shit matters at all. So just enjoy yourself.
Nothing exists, all is shadow and illusion.
As joy dwindles with the years I wistfully recall When the christmas tree Looked ten feet tall And the presents under it Seemed endless And more Than mere wrapping paper.
Because eventually there will be no life; there was once only the dust particles in space, the hot hydrogen gases, nothing more, and it will come again. This is an interval, ein Augenblick.
attribution: Philip K. Dick, The Man in the High Castle

quote: The only absolute knowledge attainable by man is that life is meaningless.
Just because we're all doomed, doesn't mean we can't have a good time.
Man suffers only because he takes seriously what the gods made for fun.
The more a thing tends to be permanent, the more it tends to be lifeless.
I don't have no fear of death. My only fear is coming back reincarnated.
Don't cry for me. I'm already dead.
People who shut their eyes to reality simply invite their own destruction.
When I watch the news, I realize that the world is run by those that never listen to music.
Sometimes, you gotta pretend everything is okay
At some point, you have to realize that some people can stay in your heart but not in your life
People cry, not because they’re weak. It’s because they’ve been strong for too long
No amount of sleep in the world could cure the tiredness I feel
Dear Past, stop tapping me on the shoulders, I don’t wanna look back
You’re scared to tell people how much it hurts, so you keep it all to yourself
The only thing standing between me and total happiness is reality
Some of the most painful scars: the ones that hurt the most are the scars that can’t be seen
It’s getting harder to hide pain
Instead of wiping your tears, wipe away the people who create them
Everytime people ask me if I’m okay, it’s just a reminder that I’m not
I need a break from the loneliness that is totally consuming me
I hate getting flashbacks from things that I don’t want to remember
Monsters don’t sleep under your bed, they scream inside of your head
I think I’m afraid to be happy because whenever I get too happy, something bad always happens
Deep inside where nothing’s fine, I’ve lost my mind
There is no greater sorrow than to recall in misery the time when we were happy
The only thing worse then being hated is being ignored…
No one cares. They’re just pretending
I forgive a lot, but I never forget what’s said and done
Everything is a battle, every breath is a war, and I don’t think i’m winning anymore
Death seems more inviting than life
You can see many smiles everyday, but you can never know whose world is actually upside down
You never know how strong you are until being strong is the only choice you have
Birth is a curse and existence is a prison.
Depression is a prison where you are both the suffering prisoner and the cruel jailer
You knew exactly what you were doing, that’s what hurts the most
Smiling has always been easier than explaining why you’re sad
Life's a bitch and then you die, that's why we get high 'cause you never know when you're gonna go.
